It also has a triple-camera setup on the back, with a 50MP main camera, a 64MP periscope telephoto lens, and a 50MP ultrawide lens. On the front, there is a 16MP selfie camera. It features a sleek and modern design, with a 6.1-inch OLED display that offers a resolution of 1080x2520 pixels and a 21:9 aspect ratio. The device is powered by a Qualcomm Snapdragon 695 5G chipset and comes with 6/8GB of RAM and 128/256GB of internal storage. It also has a triple-camera setup on the back, with a 48MP main camera, an 8MP telephoto lens, and an 8MP ultrawide lens. On the front, there is an 8MP selfie camera. The Xperia 10 V is also dust and water-resistant up to 1.5 meters for 30 minutes. It runs on Android 13 and supports fast charging. The device is available in four colors: black, white, sage green, and lavender. Its price starts at €274.55 ($349.99 / £269.99).

With a 5.45-inch IPS LCD display, 13MP main camera, 8MP front camera, and a 4860mAh battery, the Armor X12 is built to last. It also has a 2.0 GHz quad-core processor, 3GB RAM, and 32GB internal storage, which can be expanded via microSD card. The device is IP68/IP69K dust/water resistant, drop-to-concrete resistant, and MIL-STD-810H compliant, making it suitable for use in a variety of settings. Additionally, it has a 3.5mm jack, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, NFC, and USB Type-C 2.0 connectivity options. The Armor X12 runs on Android 13 (Go edition) and is powered by the Mediatek MT6761V/WAB Helio A22 (12 nm) chipset with a quad-core 2.0 GHz Cortex-A53 CPU and PowerVR GE8320 GPU. It also has a 32GB 3GB RAM internal memory and eMMC 5.1 storage. Overall, the Ulefos Armor X12 is a durable and feature-packed smartphone that is suitable for those who need a reliable device that can withstand harsh conditions.

It has a 2.5-inch TFT display with 256K colors and a secondary CSTN display with 65K colors. The phone has a VGA camera and no front-facing camera. The main display supports 1840x2208 pixels resolution and 378 PPI density, while the cover display has a resolution of 1080x2092 pixels and 408 PPI density. The device is powered by the Google Tensor G2 chipset and has 12GB of RAM and 256GB or 512GB of internal storage. It also has a triple-camera setup on the back, with a 48MP main camera, a 10.8MP telephoto lens, and a 10.8MP ultrawide lens. On the front, there is an 8MP selfie camera. The device has a 4821mAh battery with support for wired and wireless charging. It is available in two colors: Porcelain and Obsidian. The Google Pixel Fold is priced at €1,849.42 / $899.99 / £999.00.

The Mate 60 RS Ultimate is available in black and red and has a price tag of around 1550 EUR.
